snippet: After Hurricane Katrina, a woman whose family has lived on Staten Island for more than 40 years alerted public officials about the dangers of another weather disaster.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column describes devastating loss of homes in New Dorp section of Staten Island during Hurricane Sandy; Sheila Traina and her husband Dominic, who lost everything in this 'poor man's paradise' in which they lived and raised a family over four decades, say residents of the area had petitioned public officials repeatedly for the construction of a sea wall, to no avail.
lead_paragraph: After Hurricane Katrina, a woman whose family has lived on Staten Island for more than 40 years alerted public officials about the dangers of another weather disaster.

headline.seo: Five Years Ago, a Citizen Warned of Staten Island’s Vulnerability
headline.main: Home Is Gone, and the Structure Is Destroyed, Too
headline.print_headline: Home Is Gone, And the Structure Is Destroyed, Too
